issue.title: Port poutine.collapse to NumPyro

repository.name: numpyro
repository.description: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by JAX for autograd and JIT compilation to GPU/TPU/CPU.

body: This looks interesting and helpful to understand those `eager.register` logics in `distributions`. I will try to add a few patterns more.

issue.title: Added Summary class for conjugate updates

repository.name: pyro
repository.description: Deep universal probabilistic programming with Python and PyTorch

issue.body:
class designed with @fritzo and @karalets

This PR:
   1. Creates an abstract Summary class to aggregate sufficient statistics
   2. Creates two subclasses BetaBernoulliSummary and NIGNormalRegressionSummary

## TODO:
- [ ] I allowed the optional inclusion of input features. Not sure if this should be separated into two classes.
- [ ] Also unclear how much flexibility I should allow in terms of input dims (scalar, 1-D, 2-D, etc)
- [x] Add tests
- [ ] Add a new section at the end of docs/source/distributions.rst, following the pattern of the "Transformed Distributions" section

issue.title: Add gamma poisson conjugacy
issue.body: This follows the pattern in DirichletMultinomial. After this, the remaining patterns in #367 are more interesting (e.g. Student = Gamma Normal, where Gamma is the prior of the inverse of `scale`).

body: @fritzo Is there a way to apply an op to a variable name? For gamma normal conjugacy, we have gamma prior for "variance", then I want to take square root of it to put into the constructor of Normal. Currently, pyro.collapse will return a string at Gamma site, so I am not sure what is the user code to exploit conjugacy for this relation. I think in principle, this is possible if instead of returning a string, we return a Variable?

issue.title: Return funsor.Variable from pyro.sample inside collapse

repository.name: pyro
repository.description: Deep universal probabilistic programming with Python and PyTorch

issue.body:
Addresses https://github.com/pyro-ppl/funsor/issues/367#issuecomment-711450825

This changes `poutine.collapse` to more eagerly convert `msg["fn"]` and `msg["value"]` to Funsors, and thereby allows `pyro.sample` statements to return `funsor.Variable`s rather than strings. This is important e.g. in @fehiepsi's use case where he transforms one of those returned variables.

@fehiepsi I tried to get this working with NumPyro but NumPyro is a little behind the Pyro version. I think you might need the `._block` logic to avoid converting the final `pyro.factor` statement to a funsor expression, but I'm not sure why I couldn't get it working.

## Tested
- [x] refactoring covered by existing tests
- [x] added a type assertion
- [x] added smoke tests with an enclosing particle plate

body: Hmm, I guess we should instead return a `Variable(name, Real)` from `pyro.sample()`. I believe you could then apply `ops.sqrt()`. I wasn't able to get this working in NumPyro, but you could adapt the Pyro version https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/pull/2676
Thanks, @fritzo! It works in NumPyro. I'll add the GammaNormal one soon.

issue.title: Add Gamma Gamma conjugacy
issue.body:
Addresses #367.

This also adds the builtin `lgamma` ops to be used in the computation of log_beta.
